An underground clock: Measuring time based on the cycles of magma flow in the Earth's crust.
A hydrological clock: Using water levels in seas and oceans as a reference for time, such as cycles in ocean tides or waterfalls.
The heartbeat clock: Measuring cycles of a human or animal heartbeat. Heart rate changes across an individualâ€™s lifetime, which can indicate age.
A geological clock: Using the study of geological formations and fossil records to track time periods, such as the different geological layers in the Earth.
A solar clock: Tracking time based on the angle of the sun, with one cycle equaling one day.
